alert.note: Alert for Grady; Thomas (Georgia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued February 11 at 9:25AM EST until February 15 at 7:00AM EST by NWS Tallahassee
info.description: ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Georgia... Ochlockonee River near Thomasville (US 84) affecting Grady and Thomas Counties. For the Ochlockonee River...including Thomasville (US 84), minor flooding is forecast. ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT FROM SUNDAY AFTERNOON TO WEDNESDAY MORNING... * WHAT...Minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Ochlockonee River near Thomasville (US 84). * WHEN...From Sunday afternoon to Wednesday morning. * IMPACTS...At 15.0 feet, Multiple access roads to boat ramps throughout the basin are flooded. Widespread flooding of wooded bottomland and adjacent farmland occurs. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 8:45 AM EST Saturday the stage was 8.7 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise above flood stage early tomorrow afternoon to a crest of 16.2 feet early Monday afternoon. It will then fall below flood stage Tuesday evening. - Flood stage is 15.0 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 16.2 feet on 01/14/1972. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov.
